title: Bayesian Models and Graphical Representations
description: Understanding Bayesian networks, graphical models, and probabilistic modeling frameworks.
learning_objectives: Understand structure and semantics of Bayesian networks
Apply conditional independence in graphical models
Design Bayesian models for real problems

content.overview: Bayesian networks provide a graphical language for representing probabilistic relationships between variables. They make complex joint probability distributions manageable through conditional independence assumptions.

bayesian_networks.definition: Directed acyclic graph where nodes are random variables and edges represent conditional dependencies
bayesian_networks.conditional_independence: Variables are independent given their Markov blanket
bayesian_networks.markov_blanket: Parents, children, and co-parents of a node

graphical_model_types.use_case: Modeling causal systems with known directionality

exact_inference.description: Systematically eliminate variables from joint distribution

exact_inference.complexity: Linear in number of edges for trees

model_design_principles.causality: Edges represent causal relationships when possible
model_design_principles.modularity: Local relationships easier to specify and understand

connections_to_active_inference.generative_models: Bayesian networks as generative models of world
connections_to_active_inference.hierarchical_models: Multi-level Bayesian networks for complex systems
connections_to_active_inference.temporal_models: Dynamic Bayesian networks for sequential inference

interactive_exercises.description: Design Bayesian networks for different problems
Perform inference in simple Bayesian networks

common_misconceptions.misconception: Bayesian networks require complete causal knowledge
common_misconceptions.clarification: Can represent associations even without causal understanding

common_misconceptions.misconception: All conditional independencies must be specified
Bayesian networks are only for discrete variables
common_misconceptions.clarification: Can handle continuous variables with appropriate distributions
